title: BBC Local Live: Channel Islands on Tuesday 16 January 2018 - BBC News
summary: guernsey education boss 'confident about three-school model plans ' .
islands ' poultry owners warned over bird flu .
man in custody after 'having offensive weapon in fight ' in jersey .
jersey chamber of commerce blasts new retail tax .
gale-force winds expected and some sailings disrupted .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 07:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for the channel islands have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 07:00 on wednesday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight for the channel islands on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .

documents.title: politicians to make changes to same sex marriage law
text: politicians want to make changes to jersey 's draft marriage law to make it `` more clear '' and `` correct errors '' .
states members voted to approve the idea of a same-sex marriage law in november last year , but it will face a full review before it is introduced .
members of a scrutiny panel have asked for several changes :
the draft law is due to be debated by the states assembly on the 30th of january .
author: Chris Rayner
BBC Radio Jersey Political Reporter

documents.title: beach cleaning groups hit the sand over the weekend
text: litter washed up from winter storms was tackled by more than 550 volunteer beach cleaners in jersey , guernsey , alderney and herm over the weekend .
the event was coordinated by alderney wildlife trust , littlefeet environmental jersey , la societe guernesiaise and surfers against sewage in herm .
organisers said : `` with the help of hundreds of volunteers we collectively up over a tonne of rubbish from our beaches , including 383 plastic bottles . ''
volunteers observed many of the items were single-use plastics , including cutlery , straws , coffee cups and balloons , the charity said .
some more `` unusual items '' included a frying pan , pillows , a pool tube and a monopoly hotel .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: poultry keepers told to 'keep watch ' after flu outbreak
text: poultry keepers in guernsey should `` keep a close watch '' on their birds for signs of bird flu after an outbreak in dorset .
bird flu was found in 17 wild waterfowl at a site there last week .
it is the first confirmed finding of the virus in the uk this winter .
states vet david chamberlain said poultry keepers should `` try and minimise contact between domestic poultry and wild birds '' following the outbreak .
he said : `` in truth , poultry keepers should maintain good biosecurity at all times , but it is even more important during an outbreak such as this . ''
he added : `` additionally , if keepers experience higher than normal mortality in their flock , they should contact their own private veterinary practitioner in the first instance . ''
further advice from the uk 's department for environment can be found here .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: campaigners call for 'fair ' vote on historic church plans
text: a heritage campaigner has said he will only accept a parish meeting decision on an extension to st lawrence church if the voting process is `` fair '' .
a meeting has been called to decide if plans to build a kitchen and toilet on the ancient building should go ahead .
campaigners have opposed the plans , calling them `` unnecessary '' .

marcus binney , president of save jersey 's heritage , said the group would respect the decision of a parish assembly - but it wanted to know more about the process before agreeing to accept the outcome .
we have n't been told what the process is , who can speak , how the meeting will be arranged .
obviously we would want to know that before saying that we 'll accept whatever happens .
it must be a fair process , with both sides allowed to put their point of view , and a vote taken among the parishioners . ''
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: university funding for jersey students unclear after 2019
text: jersey 's treasury minister has said he can not guarantee funding will be available to pay for university tuition fees after 2019 , but he was hopeful it would continue .
at the 2018 budget debate , the government announced plans to increase student grants and pay university tuition fees for most students .
but in today 's states sitting senator alan maclean said he did not know where the extra £ 4m would come from after 2019 .
he said he could not force the next government to find the money , but he expected it would be available .
more on this story :
author: Chris Rayner
BBC Radio Jersey Political Reporter

documents.title: weather : heavy showers with possible thunder
text: heavy showers will continue overnight , with a continuing risk of hail and thunder .
remaining windy with gales likely .
minimum temperature : 3c ( 37f ) .
moving into wednesday , it will continue to feeling cold with strong winds easing and showers becoming lighter and more isolated .
it will become windy again into the evening , with heavy rain arriving overnight .
maximum temperature : 8c ( 46f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: honey fungus an 'ongoing issue ' in guernsey
text: honey fungus has been highlighted as one of the biggest killers of woody plants in guernsey .
local activists said it was particularly hard to spot at this time of the year as most trees and shrubs had no leaves .
the disease thrives in both wet and warm conditions .
the secretary of guernsey 's trees for life charity , andy mccutcheon , said that , once a plant had contracted the disease , there was very little that stopped it .
you should remove the tree or shrub , and remove as much of the roots system as is practical to do so .
you 're trying to remove the food source , because the fungus is eating away at the wood of the stump . ''
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: tamba park to cut its opening hours
text: one of jersey 's best-loved family attractions is no longer opening on mondays or tuesdays during term time .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: independent lifeboat petition handed into states
text: a petition calling on the states to support the jersey independent lifeboat service has been signed by 6,780 people .
the group was set up after the rnli sacked the st helier crew and briefly closed the lifeboat station last year .
members of the crew said the group was hoping to be officially registered as a charity later this week , and preparations have been made to buy an all-weather lifeboat .
the petition was handed to the states by senator sarah ferguson .
author: Chris Rayner
BBC Radio Jersey Political Reporter

documents.title: st clement 's battle of flowers 2018 future in question
text: the parish of st peter will consider offering its battle of flowers shed to st clement if the parish takes a year out of the competition , its constable has said .
at an emergency meeting last night , the st peter battle of flowers association failed to find a new chairman , so may not compete this year .
constable john refault said his parish would consider sharing resources between parishes to keep the tradition alive .
if we can help another team to stay in battle , that would be a good way of doing it .
maybe we can attract some people from st clement to work in our nice warm shed . ''
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: thunderstorm warning issued
text: thunderstorm warning issued at 16:12 utc , 16/01/2018 .
author: Twitter

documents.title: top committee to stay 'neutral ' in education debate
text: staying `` neutral '' ahead of an important debate on the future of post-16 education in guernsey is the aim of politicians sitting on the government 's most senior committee .
the policy and resources committee said it wanted the school model which offered the most flexibility for the states .
in a letter of comment on the government 's plans , deputy st gavin pier said he believed neither of the proposed models were `` without challenges '' .
he said the three-school model and its two-school alternative were , to a degree , `` incomplete '' .
deputy st pier said his committee had not found a single `` overwhelming argument '' in favour of either plan .
as a result , he said , the committee had concluded it would come down to a matter of `` political judgement '' for each individual states member in tomorrow 's debate .
author: Simon Fairclough
Guernsey Political Reporter

documents.title: crash on rue des trodez
text: fire crews are attending a crash on rue des trodez in st ouen involving two cars .
drivers have been advised to avoid the area .
2 car rtc at rue des trodez junction , please avoid area # greenwatch
author: Twitter

documents.title: effect of 'non-native ' marine life to be monitored
text: a growing number of `` non-native marine species '' needs to be monitored and reported better , jersey 's environment department says .
a study was commissioned by the states after creatures such as the american slipper limpet and foreign seaweeds such as wakame were found .
as a result , 43 non-native marine species have been discovered in channel island waters .
of those , 25 were found which are `` probably established '' but had yet to be identified , and 66 `` other species '' observed that had the potential to reach the islands and establish themselves .
according to the study , the channel islands was `` attractive '' to an `` unusually large '' number of foreign marine species from the english channel , north sea and bay of biscay .
non-native species often arrive in the area via the shallow seabed and strong tidal currents , or with commercial and leisure shipping , the department found .
judging the likely effect of a newly arrived non-native species is n't straightforward .
as with so many areas of the environment , by the time the scale of a threat is realised , it can be too late to do anything about it .
however , as a result of this study , we now have a strong baseline of information from which to develop an approach .
we also have strong relationships with neighbouring countries which we can develop and build on to share knowledge and resources . ''
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: poultry owners warned as bird flu hits dorset
text: jersey poultry keepers are being urged to check for signs of bird flu in their animals after an outbreak in dorset .
bird flu was found in 17 wild waterfowl at a site there last week .
it is the first confirmed finding of the virus in the uk this winter .

states vet theo knight-jones said : `` we know the virus can spread by wild birds , so owners of poultry need to think about maintaining good biosecurity to reduce the risk of the virus spreading to their birds . ''
he added the virus could cause `` high mortality '' amongst birds , which could have a wider impact by restricting the poultry trade .
the states said islanders should report any dead swans , geese , ducks or other dead birds such as gulls or birds of prey to the veterinary office .
further advice from the uk 's department for environment can be found here .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: cannabis-based medicine 'will be free of charge '
text: a cannabis-based medical product used to treat patients with multiple sclerosis - sativex - will be made available `` free of charge '' when prescribed and supplied from jersey 's hospital , the states has said .
the product ranges bedrocan and tilray oral solutions may also be reclassified under the island 's misuse of drugs laws , so they may be prescribed , the states said .

in answer to a written question to the states by deputy montfort tadier , a spokesman said discussions with potential supplies of cannabis-based products made to the correct standards had `` recently concluded '' .
plans to move forward with changes to the law were delayed in december last year .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: police and fire attend chimney blaze
text: police and fire crews in guernsey were called to reports of a chimney fire in st martins .
crews reported the blaze on icart road at about 12:44 .
the fire was extinguished by 13:00 and emergency services stood down .
no one was injured .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'febrile and toxic system of government needs to change '
text: guernsey 's top politician , gavin st pier , has called for an overhaul in the constitution of the states , describing the current system as 'febrile and toxic ' .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: english translation of jersey 's history released
text: piracy , plague and political intrigue is what you can expect from a new translation of jersey 's history from 1460-1585 .
les chroniques de jersey , originally penned by an unknown author , has been translated from french by bronwyn matthews , a librarian at societe jersiaise .

the chronicle , thought to be the earliest account of jersey 's history , describes the settlement of sark , the impact of the protestant reformation on the island and the lives of jersey 's prominent families of the day .
working on this translation has taken me on a fascinating journey into jersey 's past and enabled me to see the channel islands in a whole new light .
i am happy to be making this history available to a wider audience . ''
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: overbury plane crash : dead were instructor and student
text: two men who died when a light aircraft crashed have been named as flight instructor john smith , 52 , formerly based in jersey , and student ahmed abdullah , 24 .
the single-engine plane was on its way to gloucestershire airport when it came down at bredon hill , near the village of overbury on 8 january .
the plane was from a fleet belonging to aeros flight training .
the cause of the crash is being looked into by the air accidents investigation branch ( aaib ) .
eveline hawkin , from jersey aero club said members were `` terribly saddened '' to hear of mr smith 's death .
she said the pilot learnt to fly at the club in 1997 before deciding to take it up as a career .
john was just a charming , delightful , very lively person who was very kind and thoughtful .
we will greatly miss him . ''
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: recruitment fears for post-16 education 'overplayed '
text: fears about `` recruitment difficulties '' which could be caused by separating secondary and further education in guernsey have been `` overplayed '' , according to a uk expert .
the proposals are part of the government 's plans to provide secondary education from three schools .
an alternative model , which would see one school providing secondary and sixth form education across two sites , has been put forward by deputies outside of the education committee .

bill watkin , chief executive of the uk 's sixth form colleges association , said he believed it would be unlikely to have a major impact , and suggested a separate college would allow a broader range of subjects to be accessed by students .

one of the things that they [ sixth form colleges ] do is provide an opportunity to develop some specialist expertise , because what the teachers do , all day , every day , is teach a-level - or the equivalent of a-level - to sixth form students .
this means they can perform at a very high standard . ''
author: Euan Mahy
BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: agency change 'blocked by civil servants '
text: senior civil servants and the finance industry have been accused by former economic development president peter ferbrache of blocking a joint non-governmental promotion agency for bailiwick businesses .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: new island pension scheme 'a benefit to the community '
text: just over 20,000 islanders in guernsey and alderney will have the opportunity to save more money for their retirement in a new private pension scheme planned for 2020 .
the scheme will automatically enrol islanders but will not be made compulsory to join , and projections suggest about 12,200 people will not qualify due to low income levels .
once it is up and running , employees will contribute 6.5 % of their salary into the new pension , with employers contributing 3.5 % , according to the states .
a spokesman said the scheme would encourage employers who did not currently offer a pension to do so , as they may face administration fees .
social security committee president michelle le clerc said it would particularly benefit pensioners who earned less in work .
the president of the policy and resources committee , gavin st pier , said the scheme could be fully established by 2027 , and was `` in the best interests of the community '' .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: sark sailings cancelled tomorrow 'due to weather '
text: sailing update for 17.01.18 due to predicted adverse weather conditions , tomorrows scheduled sailings are cancelled - a review will be made at 9am with a view to depart guernsey at 10am and depart sark at 11am.for further info please call our office on 724059
author: Twitter

documents.title: former jersey instructor died in light aircraft crash
text: a former jersey pilot died when his light aircraft crashed into a field in thick fog in the uk earlier this month , it has emerged .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: parish should choose church plans together - rector
text: parishioners of st lawrence church deserve a `` free vote '' on on whether there should be an extension on the church , the rector has said .
rev phil warren said he was fed up with what he described as `` vitriolic attacks '' against him for the plans , which would see a toilet and kitchen built onto one of the church 's doorways .
he has halted the work ahead of a parish assembly , which he said would decide the matter `` once and for all '' .
they 're coming to vote with their on thoughts , their own opinions as to whether they want this to happen .
so , for me , [ we need ] that sense of calm and perspective , and to ensure what we choose to do as a parish , we choose to do this together .
it 's not just for us , it 's for our children and future generations . ''
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: weather watcher captures cloudy skies over channel
text: weather watcher veteran chris cumulus bring us this view from guernsey this morning .
are you out and about today in the channel islands ?
you can sign up to be a bbc weather watcher here .

documents.title: states assembly : coming up in the debate today
text: today , the jersey 's states assembly will sit for the first time this year .
the meeting is due to start at 10:45 , which is slightly later than usual , as states members will attend a church service to mark the start of the 2018 session .
some of the areas members will be discussing include proposals to :
you can listen to the session live here .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: man charged after weekend fight
text: a man has been charged with affray and possession of an offensive weapon after an an incident on sunday , police have said .
officers said a 32-year-old was due to appear at jersey magistrate 's court this morning .
firearms officers were called to the parade on sunday after reports a knife was seen .
a 44-year-old man who was also arrested has been released on police bail .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: eight vehicles damaged in car park
text: guernsey police are appealing for witnesses after windows were smashed and on eight vehicles parked overnight in st peter port .
it happened at forest park hotel on route de la foret , st martin , some time between 19:00 and 22:45 on 9 january .
officers also said the vehicles were `` accessed '' in the incident .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: population drop is more worrying than increase , says gorst
text: jersey should be more worried about population decline in the future rather than excessive immigration , as automation threatens island jobs , the chief minister has said .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: storm warning is upgraded
text: jersey 's met department have upgraded its earlier weather warning from orange to red - the highest available .
a tide alert has also been issued , with the met office warning there may be spillages and debris coming over the sea walls around the island .
wind warning № 52/1 , issued at 08:48 utc , 16/01/2018 .
author: Twitter

documents.title: weather : cold , with sunny spells
text: feeling cold today across the channel islands , with sunny spells and frequent showers .
these will be heavy and blustery with a risk of hail and thunder .
it may be windy with gales on exposed coasts later .
maximum temperature : 9c ( 48f )
jersey :

documents.title: chamber of commerce blasts new retail tax
text: retailers in jersey have again urged the treasury not to bring in a new tax on their profits .
the jersey chamber of commerce has said its members were not consulted on the changes , as had been claimed during the budget debate .
the decision in this year 's budget means large retailers who make profits over £ 500,000 should pay up to 20 % in corporation tax .
despite pressure to reduce this to 10 % , the states agreed it , with treasury minister alan maclean saying he did not believe the tax would causes prices to rise in shops .
but now the chamber says some of the information used during the debate was `` misleading '' .
while it was claimed there had been consultation with the industry , the chamber denies this , and says the states should not have agreed to the tax based on the information provided .
a spokesman said members of the chamber were hoping the states would `` reconsider '' , adding it had offered to work with the treasury to allow a `` correct consultation '' to take place .
author: Josephine Baker
BBC Radio Jersey, Reporter

documents.title: sailings from guernsey to sark 'disrupted '
text: today 's sailing are disrupted today 's combined passenger and cargo sailings will be brought forward to depart guernsey at 08:45am and depart sark at 10:45am

documents.title: education committee 'confident ' about three-school model
text: a guernsey deputy behind the governments proposals for the future of secondary education is `` quite confident '' his committee 's proposals will win .
politicians will debate the future of secondary and post-16 education on wednesday .

deputy paul le pelley , president of the committee for education , sport and culture , has said including an inclusive sixth form college , and a further and higher institute with plans to create a guernsey university college , are the right ones for the island .
he said : `` i think we know the feeling is divided .
it 's divided in the states , it 's divided among the teachers , it 's divided among the parents .
so it 's going to be very , very interesting to see which argument comes forward .
`` personally i 'm feeling quite confident that the three-school model will win because it is the better model . ''
there are two main proposals : one creating three community secondary schools , supported by the education committee ; and a two-school model proposed as an alternative .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: man in custody after 'having offensive weapon in fight '
text: a 32-year-old man is in police custody on sus of possessing an offensive weapon after a fight in jersey , police say .
a 40-year-old , suspected of causing a breach of the peace by fighting , has been released .
neither have been charged .
armed police were called to the parade on sunday after reports a knife had been seen .
one officer is thought to have drawn a taser , although it was n't used .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for tuesday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for the channel islands today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
